sentences.english: She always gave her customers cordial smiles.
sentences.chinese: 她总是对她的顾客莞尔而笑。

sentences.english: Don't take yourself too seriously; laugh at your slipups and faults.
sentences.chinese: 不要太过严肃，不妨对自己的过错和缺点莞尔一笑。

sentences.english: He shot a smile at his wife.
She gave me a smile in exchange for my help.
sentences.chinese: 我帮了她一忙博得了她的莞尔一笑。

sentences.english: Can not help but smile, a touch of very few words, just counting the knowledge bar .
sentences.chinese: 不禁莞尔，淡淡的很少说话，只是算认识吧。

sentences.english: But she had only smiled a little and her eyes had admitted nothing.
sentences.chinese: 但她只是莞尔一笑，眼里并没有任何表示。

sentences.english: The Robert smiles to the Gordon and shocks his head and no longer speaks.
sentences.chinese: 罗柏特对高登莞尔一笑，摇了摇头，不再吭声。

sentences.english: Six years later, Jiang smile back to hometown.
sentences.chinese: 六年后，姜莞尔回到故里。

sentences.english: Heck, it might even put a smile on the mail carrier's face.
sentences.chinese: 它甚至让邮差莞尔一笑。

sentences.english: She smiles whenever she sees him.
sentences.chinese: 她每次见到他时就莞尔一笑。

definition: to laugh in spite of oneself/to be unable to help laughing/to break into laughter
to laugh involuntarily/Taiwan pr. [e4 ran2 shi1 xiao4]
cannot help laughing/unable to restrain a smile
to have a smile on one's face
